text: [Music]
with the world changing and Technology
changing we recognized that we would
need to Pivot to better serve our
partners and innovate in the Democracy
field if we were going to remain
relevant AWS cloud computing paired with
mobile and social and some of the other
huge trends that are taking place today
really are helping us better innovate
and stay
competitive I'm Chris Spence I'm Chief
technology officer at a group called ndi
The National Democratic in Institute we
have 1,400 staff about 250 of which are
at the H headquarters but we actually
serve a very Glo diverse Global set of
employees and partners working with
technology around the world we'll work
with election monitoring groups and
other civil society organizations to
help ensure that the government is
carrying out Fair elections and and
being held to account for good
policy ndi recognized about four years
ago when we started our journey to the
cloud that uncertain funding in the
future for Democratic development really
we needed make sure that we had a
flexible it organization so what we did
was begin to move migrate applications
through the cloud because we needed to
ensure that our Tech staff with limited
resources and limited budget that wasn't
likely to expand were able to meet
increasing staff
demand we chose AWS as our cloud
provider because one it's a lower cost
alternative to on premises hosting
second it's easier for our technology
people to install and maintain
applications in AWS and finally we can
scale our program so in in situations
where we've got to scale up and scale
down around political events like
elections or other activities AWS can
easily help us give the machine
resources we need into the applications
when we need it and then scale back
therefore optimizing our overall
costs ndi uses a range of AWS Services
starting with ec2 where we host up to
right now about 53 instances in na AWS
Cloud we use uh S3 for data storage and
really enjoy snapshots and and in
automating our backup process which has
been phenomenal for us ndi has also been
able to leverage Auto scaling on elastic
cache for high availability applications
where we needed to be able to spin up
applications that could could scale with
demand and then scale back
automatically things that were not
possible 5 or 10 years ago in terms of
scaling infrastructure of building
reusable tools of offering services to
low people in low infrastructure
environments all of those things are now
possible with the cloud and it opens up
a whole new area of innovation where we
can look at not just making old process
is better in helping these Partners but
actually thinking of new approaches to
empower people to strengthen their
Democratic institutions in their
countries
[Music]
